title: JK Rowling fires off scathing responses to former fans who threaten to burn their Harry Potter books
text:
JK Rowling fires off scathing responses to former fans who threaten to burn their Harry Potter books The sassy author has been shutting down readers who have threatened to torch their Potter merchandise Share JK Rowling responds to her critics (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share     
J.K. Rowling isn't afraid to voice her opinion on Twitter. 
And most recently, the Harry Potter author dished out a number of quick-witted comebacks to people who disagreed with her anti-Donald Trump opinions. 
"@Jk_rowling glad I caught this article on yahoo. I will now burn your books and movies too," one wrote. 
And she soon fired back with: "Well, the fumes from the DVDs might be toxic and I've still got your money, so by all means borrow my lighter." 
And her sassy responses didn't stop there. 
"Just burned all my Harry Potter books after being a fan for 17 years," another tweeted her. 
"The Phils. Stone was one of the first books I EVER read. I'm upset it has to be that way... You embarrassed me, disgusted me, and I will never read your work again." 
"Guess it's true what they say: you can lead a girl to books about the rise and fall of an autocrat, but you still can't make her think," Rowling responded. 
A third Twitter user then told her to "stay out of politics". JK Rowling (Photo: Getty) 
He wrote: "You're a grown woman whose entire career is based on stories about a nerd who turns people into frogs. Stay out of politics." 
But once again, she replied with a witty comeback, writing: "In - Free - Countries - Anyone - Can - Talk - About - Politics,' she responded. "Try sounding out the syllables aloud, or ask a fluent reader to help." Like us on Facebook
